author: schweiz9
content: Hello. Am I right that I can practically do it the same way (cut heavy files and paste it in HDD -> symlink them) in geth (or any other execution implementations)?

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: In geth you can use `--ancients` to put the chain history on an hdd (no need to symlink stuff)

author: schweiz9
content: but first off I have to wait until fully synced and only **then** play around with files? Or I can just wait 10 mins or something where chain history files will be created -> stop geth daemon -> apply "--ancients" and then geth will start puts heavy files on the hdd?

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: Its best to do it before you even start syncing

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: Otherwise you need to manually move the files around
